What will be the output of the following code?

using namespace std;

class Base {
public:
    virtual void print() {
        cout << "Base ";
    }
};

class Derived : public Base {
public:
    void print() override {
        cout << "Derived ";
    }
};

int main() {
    Base* arr[2];
    arr[0] = new Base;
    arr[1] = new Derived;
    for (int i = 0; i < 2; ++i) {
        arr[i]->print();
    }
    return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following code?

using namespace std;

class A {
public:
    A() {
        cout << "A ";
    }
    A(int x) {
        cout << "A" << x << " ";
    }
};

class B : public A {
public:
    B() {
        cout << "B ";
    }
    B(int y) {
        cout << "B" << y << " ";
    }
};

int main() {
    B obj(5);
    return 0;
}

questions.question:

using namespace std;

class A {
public:
    virtual void func() {
        cout << "A ";
    }
};

class B : public A {
public:
    void func() override {
        cout << "B ";
    }
};

int main() {
    B b;
    A& ref = b;
    ref.func();
    return 0;
}

questions.question:
What will be the output of the following code?

using namespace std;

class A {
public:
    virtual void print() {
        cout << "A ";
    }
};

class B : public A {
public:
    void print() override {
        cout << "B ";
    }
};

int main() {
    A* arr[2];
    arr[0] = new A;
    arr[1] = new B;
    for (int i = 0; i < 2; ++i) {
        arr[i]->print();
    }
    return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following code?

using namespace std;

class A {
public:
    virtual void func() {
        cout << "A ";
    }
};

class B : public A {
public:
    void func() override {
        cout << "B ";
    }
};

int main() {
    B b;
    A* aptr = &b;
    B* bptr = dynamic_cast<B*>(aptr);
    if (bptr) {
        bptr->func();
    }
    return 0;
}
